Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler77770
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in London for aweek. It was nice service. Had a good stay. Close to Paddington Station.

Reviews.Title: “Was perfect for my needs and budget.”
Reviews.Author: Bercko21
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel on this site after looking for low budget hotels. Free WiFi, free TV, very nice and cozy room with everything a solo traveler needs. Hotel is smoking friendly which is nice in England during winter. The staff was very kind and polite. The English breakfast was a nice bonus since I didn't much other hotel offering it in this price range. Overall a very good hotel, I would definitely would to return there on my next visit to London.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, Great location!”
Reviews.Author: gregm155
Reviews.Content: We were there for 4 days. great location only a short walk from Paddington Station! Close to Hyde Park. The family room was clean and comfortable! Staff was very friendly and helpful. Got to check in early which was nice. Would stay there again and would recommend it to friends!

Reviews.Title: “Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: Sean C
Reviews.Content: Twin room was warm, staff friendly, breakfast was good. great location, and for the price to stay in this area, it has to be said that it was value for money. Not perfect, but i would book to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: so s
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 3 nights at this hotel I would recomend this hotel for a short stay if you will spend most of your time out it has its advantages wich are : - near to paddington station (that has a direct train from and to hethrow airport) - friendly staff - clean room & clean bathroom. - free wifi. - fast check-in and check-out process and the disadvantage : - it has only one very very slow elevator. - the room that we had, have a door to the next room and that was very noisy, we feel like we live with our neighbors! - the room was very small, we hardly can stay with our luggage. - the carpet needs to change. - very limited breakfast choice (but it was not bad ) - bed quality was poor ! so it is not a good place to relaxation or spoiling yourself, it is good for saving money for shopping ;)

Reviews.Title: “okay”
Reviews.Author: Braithy26
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 8 nights in June. The breakfasts were very good and fast. The room was not too bad, was tired looking but clean. The room was also at the front of the hotel so was a little bit noisy, but nothing to complain about as we could both sleep and quite well too! The location is wonderful, very close to the tube etc. The staff weren't very friendly. The man (possibly the owner?) was rude, ask for an adaptor and he asked us why we needed one/why we didn't have one. If customer service isn't a priority, this hotel will be good enough for you. Because of the location, I would consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money in London”
Reviews.Author: JonesRon
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very convenient to Paddington Station. The staff are very pleasant and helpful. The hotel and rooms are a bit dated. The rooms I have used have been clean and bed linen and beds have been comfortable. The full english breakfast is included in the price. Not the Ritz but not the price either! A value for money stay in an expensive London.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION!!”
Reviews.Author: jan and john f
Reviews.Content: Spent 6 nights at Mitre House in September/October 2011. Rooms SMALL - no room for 2 large suitcases - HOWEVER, clean, good breakfast with friendly staff, FANTASTIC LOCATION - easy walk to pubs, restaurants, Paddington Station, bus stops etc etc. They held some luggage for us while we did a Europe trip because we were coming back to stay there - which was very safe and helpful. Jan & John F AUSTRALIA

Reviews.Title: “Good location n affordable!”
Reviews.Author: Linawaty
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in Sept 2011. We enjoyed the English breakfast. Good location. Carpets need to change for adding good value. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Okay for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: Grazia1974
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mitre House Hotel for two nights and found the hotel to be exactly as other reviewers described it on Tripadvisor. The hotel is located in a beautiful neighbourhood and close to Paddington Station. Bus stops and tube stations as well as a large number of restaurants are nearby. Our room was clean but looked quite dark and old-fashioned. Staff members were mostly nice and welcoming. Breakfast was definitely not "generous" as stated on the hotel's website - we did not get full English breakfast, but only components such as egg, beans OR a fried tomato, mushrooms and bacon and some toast with butter and jam and marmalade. We could also have ordered some cereals, but as breakfast was served we were not really able to decide how much we would have liked. All in all, the hotel can be recommended for people looking for a clean accomodation near Paddington station but considering the price (we paid 85 pounds) it does not really offer great value for money. It is okay for London, but definitely does not have the standard you can expect anywhere else in the UK if you pay 85 pounds.

Reviews.Title: “An accommodation to recommend”
Reviews.Author: Isolde J
Reviews.Content: My daughter and me stayed here for 3 nights and were very satisfied with the accommodation. It's situated near Paddington Station, so it's a great and safe place to explore London. The hotel staff are helpful and friendly people. The rooms are clean and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Central London Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alison127
Reviews.Content: Our stay here was our second at this Hotel. Firstly it is in a great location for visiting London as there are two underground stations nearby and of course plenty of bus options. The front desk staff are friendly and helpful. The hotel decor hasn't been updated in years but it is pleasant and very clean. The breakfast each morning which was very tasty and with no shortage of tea, coffee and toast was served by very pleasent staff. The breakfast consisted of orange juice, museli or cornflakes and a hot breakfast of bacon, egg, tomatoes and mushrooms. They swap the tomatoes every second day for beans. The hotel is quiet at night and the beds comfortable. The sheets however on the double beds barely fit so they can't be tucked in. There are plenty of restaurants and pubs very close by to choose from. Having stayed here twice I would have no problem recommending it to anyone who wants a clean central London hotel to stay in at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Well placed for budget travelers, basic but clean - it works!”
Reviews.Author: hunnybunx
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights in this hotel and honestly, have nothing to complain about. It is indeed well placed between 2 tube stations. Just round the corner are eating places and convenience stores for water/fruits/light bites. Given that it's summer, the environment is so pleasant with lush tree-lined avenues. Breakfast is basic but served, unlike some budget hotels I have stayed in where its self-service. My room was on ground floor - carpet was clean, sheets were clean, room was quiet, TV worked, water pressure was good. Front desk staff are at best helpful and at worse 'utilitarian' (some wld smile, some wld not) For GBP80 in central London - really, can't fault it. Only wished the bed was a bit firmer,,,

Reviews.Title: “Could have been so much better......”
Reviews.Author: pongoo1
Reviews.Content: The Mitre house hotel could so much better than it actually is, it is in a great location and in spitting distance from paddington station, but unfortunately the hotel falls down on so many factors! We were faced with a blood stained quilt on one of the beds,(it was soon replaced) which obviously put us off straight away! We found the day staff polite and fairly helpful, but the night staff very obnoxious. The rooms were clean but very old and dated. Breakfast was very basic and didn't seem to consist of what was on the menu? As people have already said, 'you get what you pay for', and that is true of this hotel, we wouldn't stay here again, but it seems such a shame due to the fact of the location. Having said all this, there are allot of other hotels along the same road......Mitre house hotel , listen to what people are saying!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Was good in the seventies...”
Reviews.Author: Anna1963Belgium
Reviews.Content: It was clean, it is close to Paddington station and tube and the Polish & Portugese girls at the reception wer super nice. But that's about it. This hotel should be closed and totally renewed. If you have a dust allergy, stay away from this place! The rooms are one big brown-beige blur of carpets and curtains that are old and stinky... The breakfast procedure is hilarious, in a communist sort of way.

Reviews.Title: “Would Not Recommend!!”
Reviews.Author: Gillian1213
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about this hotel is the location is within walking distance of Paddington Train station and Hyde Park. The hotel is seriously dated, my childen noticed bites on their legs after we left (bed bugs??). The bathroom smelled like urine and the overall hotel smelled musty. The staff was rude and the breakfast was pathetic. I asked for an soft egg for breakfast and all I got was the egg, you have to specify that you also want the bacon and tomato with it..

Reviews.Title: “Worth it for the location”
Reviews.Author: jrdek
Reviews.Content: Quaint would be a good word to describe this hotel. Very basic but if you plan to spend your days out and about, it is adequate for the price. Only a 3 minute walk to Heathrow Express, trains, underground, and buses. This made getting around the city so easy. I would endure the bad breakfast and basic room to stay here again for the convenience.

Reviews.Title: “you get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: nigelr182
Reviews.Content: If your are on a tight budget and suspend your normal expectations of service and choice then this will not come as a shock. The room was clean and functional, however, it did leak when it rained heavily during the night. Breakfast was very basic and there was little choice, and no facility to serve onself. Staff on reception were a little frosty. Fire doors were wedged open during day and night on occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: TheTraveling3
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here. The staff was very accommodating and hospitable. The location was good- right near Paddington Station. The rooms were very clean, and I would have rated them 5 star for cleanliness instead of 3 star except for the pillows and mattresses (at least in our room) were really in need of replacing. There was no charge for the parking (amazing in that area!), the Wifi was free and breakfast was included and served. You could control your own heating temperature in the room and/or open a window for ventilation which was very nice. The shower was great! In our room's hallway, occasionally there was this consistent clicking sound - but then it would stop. Don't know if it was because our room was next to the elevator. Guess we could have asked about it, but instead just closed our bedroom door; we couldn't hear it then. The staff was very professional, answered questions, and helped us with directions. The hotel is decorated in a very charming manner and we enjoyed sitting in the lobby later in the evening enjoying a beverage and watching something on the tv.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Clean but very basic”
Reviews.Author: OnZeeEdge
Reviews.Content: The location is top - just a few minutes walk to Paddington Station and Tube. We were given a twin room instead of a double - oh well. The furniture and fittings were very dated (late 60s?) but everything was very clean and seemed to work well. The hotel includes an English breakfast in the rate, available 7-9am I think - but dont fret if you sleep in - it's not very particularly good. (Eggs are fine, sausages disappointing, coffer unbearable). If this were any city other than London I'd be inclined to say it's overpriced by far. But it is in London - so I won't...

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT stay in this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: smserban
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. The customer service from the owners/managers was appalling. The facilities are hardly adequate even for the most unpretentious customer.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, basic facilities”
Reviews.Author: cedric09
Reviews.Content: Striking a good balance between location and economy, Mitre House provides basic facilities at reasonable prices. Because we were in London during the visit of the Pope, all available rooms in the vicinity of Hyde Park were booked well in advance. We felt fortunate to find a place at Mitre House. Despite the fact that the room was in the basement, it had good ventilation and was very clean. The full English breakfast served every morning in the dining room was well prepared and of excellent quality. Front desk staff are attentive and professional. Good value for a (relatively) modest price.

Reviews.Title: “Good Price for the Location”
Reviews.Author: LCM85
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last minute as our previous hotel had cancelled our booking without telling us and Mitre was the only hotel nearby with vacancies. Good price for the great location right neat Paddington station and close to Hyde Park. Hotel did smell smokey and the rooms were dated but clean. You get for what you pay for!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location at budget price.”
Reviews.Author: leicsduo
Reviews.Content: We read all the current reviews at the time of booking, and decided to give it a go, as there were few vacancies left in that area. We found the female staff quite friendly and helpful, although the gentleman desk clerk was a bit miserable, the breakfast was full english and the staff were quick to serve most people who all seem to arrive half an hour before finish of service. The room was clean and even though it was on the ground floor was quiet enough to get a good night sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing stay”
Reviews.Author: Kate518
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel multiple times in the last 10 years, the last being in 2006. I had previously found it to be a good value-great location, clean rooms but nothing fancy. I had one night to spend in London after being in the UK for a wedding and chose to stay at the Mitre House Hotel again. I was very disappointed to see how run down the hotel has become. It doesn't look like any updates have been done since I was here 4 years ago. The bedding is getting old and worn. Most concerning part of my stay however was while I was lying on my bed watching tv before bed, a mouse ran out from under the bed and out underneath the gap between my door and the hallway. I called to ask for a new room immediately and they tried to put me in the room next door! Considering the mouse went into the hallway, I figured it could be anywhere on that floor, so I wanted a room on a completely different floor. This took quite a bit of convincing to occur. The front desk was reluctant to move me to another floor since all of the single rooms were on my floor and they would have to give me a double room! I will not be staying here again in the future and will have to find a new go-to hotel in London.

Reviews.Title: “Be very careful”
Reviews.Author: MrRioja
Reviews.Content: I had to stay in this hotel because my company pre-booked it for me, but I would like to warn people of what to expect. Reception staff have a take it or leave it attitude in fact seemed to go out of their way to make life awkward. Had to pack my case to be moved to another room six times in a twelve day stay. Each room reeked of cigarette smoke the pillows were unusable because of the smell. Now I don't know if this is illegal but each room they put me in the smoke detectors had been removed. There is no tea or coffee facilities in the rooms, the showers are a joke either scolding or freezing no in between, I had to ask for a remote for the tv and finally my colleagues in the other room had a long tailed visitor in the middle of the night wondering around their bedroom. These are my own personal findings and I can't comment on other things ive heard, but I shall never stay here again

Reviews.Title: “A solid value that proves you CAN do London on a budget”
Reviews.Author: B Shensky
Reviews.Content: We selected Mitre House after having canceled another nearby self-proclaimed Notting Hill "value-conscious" property, and doing so was the best thing we could have done. The hotel is appears to be and is managed as a classic (read "non-chain") property. The rooms are a little small, as are the in-room TVs, but the place is clean Clean CLEAN and comfortable to boot. When you leave the hotel, you leave the key with the front desk. There's a modest bar adjacent to the front desk that's open in the evening with modestly priced spirits. The morning's traditional English breakfast served in the garden-level commons area is unremarkable but otherwise quite pleasant. Location is FIRST RATE. It's a block from Paddington station (easy access to many Tube lines), and surrounded by quite a few restaurants. This is to be expected, since the hotel is on a block flush with a bunch of OTHER hotels. Surprisingly, the streets and gardens are nice and quiet at night. The real bonus is proximity to Hyde Park: barely three blocks away, and you kids can take in the playground while you exhale among the delights by the Serpentine. All in all, given our tight budget, our pleasant experience at the Mitre House Hotel surely enhanced our first-ever London experience.

Reviews.Title: “Average Experience”
Reviews.Author: SiteCer
Reviews.Content: I chose to stay at the Mitre House Hotel without doing any research on it as I was in need of an alternate accommodation since my original lodgings did not work out. The location is excellent since the Paddington area includes several Tube and bus lines and a rail station. My main requirement at the time was that the room be clean (which was a major problem at my first location) and it was. The room is small, as can be expected and it was cleaned every day. The shower had good water pressure but it sometimes took a while for the water to become hot. The bed was not particularly comfortable. The staff was very nice and helpful. The breakfast was okay. However, there is little choice and having corn flakes or a full English breakfast (although eggs prepared another way were also available) does become tiresome after six mornings. You can hear activity out in the hallway but I did not hear activity in neighboring rooms. The availability of wireless in-room internet access was great. The hotel served its purpose just fine but I did not find it a great value for the price paid. Others staying here will likely be fine with the property. I would recommend it from a basic standpoint and I am grateful that they had availability given the situation I was in. However, given that there are so many hotels and B&Bs in London, I will likely try another one before returning here.

Reviews.Title: “Kind of old, however it is a good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: ioliesym
Reviews.Content: Back in November, on a last minute emergency trip, me and my parents were desperately seeking to find a hotel to stay in London ,however, we couldn't find anything so a friend told us about mitre hotel. The mitre was a hotel desperately in need of a renovation and it seriously needs a change of furniture. However it is in a very convenient location just a 5 minute walk from the paddington station and it is extremely clean. However, its carpets are kind of smelly , probably due to the age of the hotel, and the single beds are very small. Other than that, the hotel is very clean, the bathroom despite its old age was kept in an excellent condition and the breakfast was very good with very warm and friendly staff. It is not the best hotel I've been to, but it was a nice last minute resort.

Reviews.Title: “Mitre House was an awesome choice!”
Reviews.Author: CallieR72
Reviews.Content: We booked the Mitre House for six nights. We arrived at 11:30 am. Even though checkin was at 2 pm we were givern room almost immediately. We booked a triple room and was pleasantly surprised that it had three beds (room 404). The room is small, but most London hotel rooms are. The location of this hotel can not be in regards to Paddington Station. It is less than a five minute walk. There are tons of places within walkind distance. The Victoria Pub down the road was great and inexpensive. The staff was extremely friendly. The breakfast is served in the basement and it is well ight and cheery. You can choose full English or cereal and toast. At a 100 pounds a day this room can not be beat. If you are looking for a posh luxurious establishment then do not stay here. However if you are looking for a clean, friendly, economical place to stay while enjoying London then stay here! I can not thank this hotel enough for an awesome stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good non-expensive hot near Paddinton Station”
Reviews.Author: PurduePR
Reviews.Content: We liked the hotel. It is less than five minutes walk from Paddinton Station. Several restaurants around... although not a lot of taste, typical of London. The exception are the curry houses in the area. The only problem that we had was that all rooms are smoking. At least that was what we were told. Our room was fine, did not smelled like cigarette but the people in the other room were smoking a lot. Anyway, we covered the door that connected both rooms with some towels.

Reviews.Title: “Fairly good value all things considered”
Reviews.Author: madisonavenue
Reviews.Content: I spent about 6 nights at the Mitre House Hotel. It is conveniently located to Paddington and has a lift. Breakfast is good, waitresses fairly friendly and front desk staff cordial. Our room had a wonderful bathroom with a tub. The cost was somewhat high, but this hotel has parking, which I believe contributes to the cost of the room....if you do not have a car, you should ask for a lower rate...those driving into London should pay more for this convenient parking location- spacious. Tea is available at the bar, but not in the rooms for whatever reason. T.V. worked well and rooms were clean.

Reviews.Title: “Positive Weekend Break”
Reviews.Author: BobobtheThames Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is very well run. There are fresh towels etc. daily; the room is cleaned each day and beds fully made up.Though rooms may be a bit small never-the-less they are more than adequate for a short stay. The staff are very friendly from reception to catering. The hotel is conveniently located with easy access to Paddington rail/tube station and food outlets. I stay there regularly and can recommend the Mitre House Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would never stay here again!!!!”
Reviews.Author: shaqe
Reviews.Content: From the outside the hotel looks nice, especially in the dark when it is lit up with a sort of green light. The inside was dated and in much need of modernisation. On arriving at our room we found it to be very small and very old fashioned with no tea or coffee making facilities. The bedding was old and worn looking and the champagne coloured bathroon and brownish tiles were like a flash back from my grandparents house from when I was a child. My partner had booked us a romantic break to propose and at no fault of his own did not think to read reviews on the hotel. Thankfully we did not spend that much time in the hotel, only to sleep. The bedroom did not have double glazing and sirens and street noise woke us up throughout the night. At breakfast we decided to have an English breakfast hoping it would fill us up for the day. There were far to many staff in the wierd old people smelling restaurant (if you can call it a restaurant) and they spoke poor English. For breakfast there were around 6 other diners with over 8 staff in the restaurant hovering around us while we ate and one woman even stood against the wall by where we ate for ages and made us feel very awkward. The breakfast that we thought could have filled us was an over cooked small peice of bacon , a cremated sausge and an egg that could have been reheated from the day before(in fact it could have all have been heated back up from the day before), it was all very greasy and my fiancee had a bad stomach all day after it. To top it off we had toast with out breakfast and as I was eating it and still had another piece left to eat, the woman who had been hovering came and took my plate from under me while I was still in the middle of eating!!! Can you believe that. I said " excuse me Im still eating" she still had my plate in her hand and looked at me confused. I said it again and pointed to my food, she still didnt give me my plate back so my fiancee had to more or less shout at her to get her to understand I was still eating and still had a peice of toast left!! Please read the reviews on this hotel, and do not stay there unless you have no option but to sleep on the street for the night!!! Would not advise anyone to stay here!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Have stayed here twice before but disappointed on third stay”
Reviews.Author: HappytravelSydney
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here most recently in October 2009. Our room on this occasion was facing in towards a back alley, so seemed dark and dingy, on previous stays we had a room overlooking a small park. There were a couple of cigarette burn marks on the bedspread and the "complimentary" matches were nearly all used (neither of us are smokers). On one occasion the manager was berating one of the night staff for not having sold any drinks in the bar on 2 nights - whilst he wasn't shouting at the young lady he certainly was loud and was conducting this reprimand at the front desk - not very professional! Location remains best drawcard of this hotel but it needs a makeover. The breakfast staff are polite and very efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely pleasant and good value.”
Reviews.Author: ElinorStockholm
Reviews.Content: After a long flight into heathrow, weighed down by bags and children, it was such a relief that the Mitre hotel was right next to the heathrow express exit at paddington. It took about 30 mins from collecting our baggage at the airport to being taken care of at the hotel. The hotel was extremely clean and handily located for seeing the sites and the park is great for the kids, who easily get bored going from shop to shop. The only down side was that the breakfast was heavy, a full English and the dining area was in a basement with no light.

Reviews.Title: “Decent budget hotel with free parking”
Reviews.Author: ML320Australia
Reviews.Content: We were on transit in London for an overnight stay before heading home to Australia and we had hired a car and needed somewhere to stay that would allow us to park our car. We were pleasantly surprised by how convenient the hotel was and they allowed us to park our car there all day if we wanted to leave and do a bit of shopping or walking around London. The staff were friendly although the rooms were a little disappointing. They were clean but dated. It definitely did not look like the hotel photos. We had room 207 which was a quad room, which had 2 single beds and a double bed, more than adequate for my family of 4. Unfortunately we had a shower screen that did not screen the water very well and after one shower, the whole bathroom was wet. One good thing was that although we needed to check out early, they were happy to store our luggage for us, if we needed them to. In saying this, I would be happy to return to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “OK - but very noisy”
Reviews.Author: Tiggerbbt
Reviews.Content: Room was nothing great - small but comfortable. But they had us in room 204 which overlooked the street and it was so noisy from the traffic that we could not sleep at night. We ended up getting some earplugs it was so bad. Even at 11:00 at night, there was a constant stream of cars on the street! Location is convenient, plenty of sites nearby. I would not stay hear again solely due to the noise from the street traffic

Reviews.Title: “Clean, cosy and good value”
Reviews.Author: Joe835
Reviews.Content: Just came back from London after 2 nights in the Mitre House. We arrived very late at night but the staff took note of this and were expecting us. The room itself was small but comfortable; it doesn't appear to be possible to book a non-smoking room though, that was a bit unfortunate. Shower/bathroom generally were fine, LCD TV on the wall had a wide selection of channels but no tea/coffee making facilities (this might be standard in London, I'm not sure). Breakfast in the basement (you descend via a very slow lift with wall-to-floor carpeting) was pleasant enough, it is a bit small (one sausage, one piece of bacon, one egg and beans) but cooked well. They ran out of sausages half an hour before end of breakfast on our second morning, a bit odd considering they were only giving one per diner! We didn't check out the bar but generally the decor in the Mitre House was dated but well-maintained. The attention to cleanliness is obvious throughout and the hotel itself is located very close to Paddington tube & mainline train station. Not the easiest hotel to get from Stansted Airport (over 1 hour on Â£19 "express" train and another 20-30 minute cab ride, Â£22 as the Tube was closed when we got there) but for Heathrow, it'd be good. Plus the area generally is quite nice, appears residential but in fact full of hotels like the Mitre!

Reviews.Title: “This is a one star, no frills budget hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Donna W
Reviews.Content: The room is small, dull, colorless and stuffy. The bed covers are old and faded. The pillows ranged from very flat and limp to very old and lumpy. The drinking glasses were not clean. The English breakfast was poorly cooked and uninspired. Some of the staff were not friendly. The toilet did not always flush, even after reporting this problem 3 days in a row. The elevator and hallways have a musty smell.

Reviews.Title: “Sort of a disappointment... and misleading photos”
Reviews.Author: nicvct
Reviews.Content: Well, we did not expect much arriving at the hotel, though I can assure you the photos povided are a bit misleading. In fact, the rooms are not that good looking, and because of the fact that we had a discount, we were given a room at the back side of the hotel, with no view whatsoever. I believe we could deal with everything else, had the staff been pleasant and polite. The male receptionist had a hideous ironic smile on his face, as if we were the poor and downtrodden tourists. Yocan find better hotels...for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great hotel and location for the money. A little shabby but everything was clean and the front desk staff was helpful. Picked it because it was a couple of blocks from the Paddington Underground station, which made it easy to get there from Heathrow and to travel the underground around London. Nice neighborhood...walk to Hyde Park. Great value. Stayed in Piccadilly Circus lasted time I was in London and definitely liked Paddington area. A little more residential and not as busy as Piccadilly but easily accessible to all the spots you want to see.

Reviews.Title: “Family run hotel with excellent access to Central London”
Reviews.Author: AlexLimassol
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel for 5 days with my wife and 7 month baby. Room was very clean and good sized compared to other hotels in the area. The staff friendly and helpfull. Excellent English Breakfast served by friently staff. Overall I would say this is probably the best hotel we have ever stayed in the Central London Area. Extremely convenient for shopping / Museums / Theatres and parking facilities if you have a car with you.

Reviews.Title: “Be Careful what you Pay”
Reviews.Author: ozbozos
Reviews.Content: We paid hotel rate of 95pounds based on a review which described it as a friendly family run hotel. We don't mind staying in small rooms, possibly a bit run down as long as they are clean. This hotel was in fact particularly clean, and very handy to London transport. However it is in much need of simple maintenance: our vanity had no doors, surfaces in the bathroom had been siliconed roughly and were lifting and although we booked a non smoking room (you can't we found out) it didn't smell smoky - it absolutely reeked of it. The greeting we got on arrival after a long flight was downright unfriendly, although later we found one of the reception staff was very pleasant. One seemed incapable of speech. Breakfast was fine, and a nice thing to have thrown in with the tarriff. We could live with all off the niggling little problems with this hotel - except being treated by one receptionist like homeless people being given a favour by allowing us to stay. So, the message from us is "Don't pay over the odds' like we did. Otherwise stay there, ignore the small deficeincies and rudeness from some, and enjoy the hearty breakfast. Subsequent experiences with other hotels were refreshingly pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Nice budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: JNasc
Reviews.Content: When searching for a hotel in London for the planned visit I was scared by the terrible reviews I've found about budget hotels. I've came across Mitre House and this was the most well reviewed and still within my budget. Better than some more expensive ones. So I was a little apprehensive when I checked in. But my apprehension disappeared as soon I've seen the room. Although not very big, was very clean and pleasant. The beds were comfortable. The bathroom, although small and not the most modern, was clean and fully functional. No smells. It was a quad room. 2 single and 1 double beds. It had an LCD TV, phone and radio. It was on the ground floor, next to the bar, but it had double doors, so I was not disturbed by any noise. The staff was gentle, specially the people assisting the breakfast. I've found the reception staff very neutral, but correct. The breakfast (included) had limited choice, but it had all what is needed for those who prefer English or continental. As said before, the staff here was very nice. Perfect. The hotel is perfectly located. Within a walking distance from Paddington Railway and Subway Stations. I can say that the stay in this hotel helped make my visit to London a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean, good located, but a litle outdated room”
Reviews.Author: kro90
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was a litle bit outdated, was living at the first flor, at room 108, small room, but clean, toilet and shower in room . the room are and located beheind the lift, but that was not a problem, no noice from the lift. The room was clean, the staff was Friendly, and breakfast was good, and was served at your table, very fast. Hotel is located in a short walk from Paddington Tupe station (5 min.) bus 15 and 23 from Picadelly was also uppersite the station. Bus 23 are also going to Portebello Road. With the tube from hotel to Heathrow only 55 min. some eating places in a very short walk from the hotel. I think there was about 20 places in 5 min. walk. Price DKK. 845,- = 81Â£. incl. breakfast Would definately return Kim

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean & superbly located.”
Reviews.Author: ChapInAKilt
Reviews.Content: The hotel may be somewhat dated but it is clean, the staff are very helpful and friendly and the location is ideal for tube, train, bus and of course Hyde Park for that evening stroll and 'wind down' before dinner at the varied choice of 'eateries' on the door step. Travelling with my family and handicapped son, the hotel's lift was a neccessity although the four steps at the front are a problem without help. Otherwise our family suite (consisting a double & twin roon plus en-suite facilities), whilst not hugely spacious (who spends much time in their room in a London hotel anyway) was very clean, tidy and comfortable as well as reasonably priced for London W2. 20 mins from the City and 30 mins from Heathrow with buses to SE London and the much of Greater London; all within 3 mins walk. All of the above make The Mitre House Hotel an ideal choice for business or leisure without blowing the family bugdet or raising the bosses eyebrows over the expense account. Would definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and very clean”
Reviews.Author: KES23
Reviews.Content: First of all I must stress that we got an online deal making it Â£65 a night, so the review is based on that rather than the hotels own rate which I wouldnt personally be happy paying. For that price we got free parking (dont underestimate how valuable that is in central london) a very very clean room, infact they even came in and changed the sheets for the second night of our stay and shower room/w.c attached. The hotel is very close to Lancaster gate tube and Hyde Park and set back off road slightly so traffic noise wasnt a problem for us. That said the cooked breakfast was fairly inedible, though the staff serving couldnt have been more helpful. Also i think it's fair to mention that the decor is dated and the hotels website is somewhat misleading in its presentation of the rooms, the photos on this site are much more representative. Finally do be aware the walls are really thin and if you are unlucky enough to be next to noisey guests this could be a real problem. Overall for Â£65 per night worth it for parking and location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: Floater08
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mitre House Hotel for 6 nights and were very happy with it. Our twin room was small but very clean and warm. The staff was very friendly. Breakfast was also good. The hotel has an excellent location close to both Paddington and Lancaster Gate underground stations which made it easy to get around the city. The only bad thing to say about our stay were loud Spanish people staying in the room next to ours. :-) After reading some of the reviews of this hotel here, we don't really understand what people are complaining about. For the price we paid we thought this was a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small room but good location”
Reviews.Author: ljr88888
Reviews.Content: We got a room at the Mitre House for the first week of Dec. 2007 while touring London. It was a good location ... only 2 blocks from Paddington Station (which is a 15-minute ride to Heathrow via the Heathrow Express) and also close to the Lancaster Gate tube station. A short walk to Hyde Park. The room was very small by American standards but probably typical for a budget hotel in London. Decor was quite dated and a little dreary and the window rattled in the wind but the bathroom was adequate and the room was kept very clean. Bed not real comfy but OK. Satellite TV with a few channels (not much to watch on British TV anyway!). The rack rate listed in the lobby was 90 pounds (about $180 at the time) ... we got it for about $160 including tax through Orbitz. The breakfast was great! - juice, egg, bacon, sausage, toast, coffee and very delicious porridge if you ask for it, all served by the friendly girls who work at the hotel. This same breakfast was advertised for 5 pounds ($10) at local cafes, so figure that in your cost. Not a bad place overall but don't go here if you're looking for glamour, a big poufy bed and a fabulous view. Go for the breakfast and convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: alexvce67
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at this hotel. The room and the bathroom were clean and large enough. The location (Tube station: Paddington) excellent for going everywhere and the area is quit and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: happy35
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel for 3 nights with my 1 year old daughter in a single room, and was very pleased indeed. The staff were welcoming, and helpful. The girls in the breakfastroom were cheerful, and the service was fast, they quickly got a highchair for my baby, and the food was on the table in no-time. Receptionstaff very helpful and cheerful also! The room was tiny,but it worked out just fine. I have no negative comments at all! Very clean and met all my expectations to that rate. Will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “A bed and little else.”
Reviews.Author: GeezArizona
Reviews.Content: The room was very small at the end of a hallway. We heard the stair traffic from the nearby door - each time it would close, our windows would rattle. At 5:30 each morning we would get the grease smells in from the kitchen and we could hear the plumbing from the room above us. There is no coffee provided ensuite. We had to ask for the TV remote and a hair dryer. We were only given 3 very thin towels in the bathroom - no face cloths or hand towels. The gentleman at the desk was surly and abrupt. We terminated our stay early and moved to another nearby hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly, helpfull staff”
Reviews.Author: thatcherrock
Reviews.Content: We ( 2 female friends) booked through a web agent, for one night , 8th sept. The agents booking confirmation to me stated '1 twin room' . On arrival at the hotel the receptionist advised us the booking was for a double room and showed me the agency copy to them, it clearly stated 'double'. The hotel was VERY busy and the receptionist could not offer a twin room but asked us to take a seat and wait for her colleague. The second lady advised us that there were no twins available and asked us to wait again whilst she tried to sort something out. A little later we were advised that it was 'sort of sorted' We were then given a small twin room but it was clean and adequate for 1 night. Much praise to the two ladies concerned for sorting out a problem that was not of the hotels making... The breakfast staff were very friendly and efficient and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Mitre House Rocks”
Reviews.Author: BRKLNTRVLR
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Mitre House for a long wekend and thought it was great. Now, we were not expecting the Four Seasons and did not get the Four Seasons. We were looking for a CLEAN place in a safe location: We Got It! Rooms: SMALL but CLEAN SERVICE: Good, we weren't looking for white glove treatment. Staff was courteous and attentive. Front desk was helpful. Location: Excellent, very close to Underground and walk to Park. Price: Outstanding Bottom Line: We went to London to see London, not a Hotel Room. Most of the time we spent at the Hotel we were asleep or just returning from or going to London Attractions. The place was perfect. If you want 5 star service, luxurious rooms, 24 hour room service, stay away. If you want an affordable place to crash, you got it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, terrible service!”
Reviews.Author: shecain
Reviews.Content: We visited London for our first time for the bank holiday weekend. As well as my girlfriend and myself staying ina double room my mum, dad & sister stayed in the family room. On arrival we were pleased that there was parking available as we arrived at 1.00pm. It was soon to become apparent why. Checking in was no problem wih a polite english lady. However, the rest of the staff were extremly rude and arrogant especially the man with blond hair. The bar is located behind the reception so he could clearly see that we were walking in their but still had to shout through for attention. His whole attitude was disgusting and if my mum was not with me i may have dragged him over the bar and gave him what for. During our stay i only saw a very small amount of people staying there. As i have studied tourism management at university it is hard to comprehend why hoteliers are letting these foriegn workers run the front desk with no experience or communication skills. Even though it was a good location i would not reccommend this hotel to anybody. We saw a dozen other small hotels on the same road which my be worth while. But this hotel is certainly not.

Reviews.Title: “Not large, but clean, comfortable, convenient, friendly”
Reviews.Author: Efm2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mitre House Hotel for eight nights in June 2007. We weren't looking for American room sizes, but something clean and comfortable on a local scale. This is what we found. We were out every day so the small size of the room didn't matter so much as a comfortable bed, good clean bathroom, working internet access, breakfast and easy access to the Tube. Paddington station (2-3 blocks away) also has the rail system to Heathrow Airport, so you save cabfare between hotel and airport, or any other train ride out of London. The hotel's street itself is tree-lined and genteel. English breakfast IMHO is nothing to write home about, but we got to meet some actual vacationing British as well as New Zealanders at the table. All languages are heard here, as in London generally. We also got very friendly, accommodating staff.

Reviews.Title: “rubbish!!”
Reviews.Author: hbrejnejrvnj
Reviews.Content: mitre house hotel has to be the worst hotel i have EVER stayed in , we found hairs and cigarette holes all over the bedding. when we first arrived the standard was poor , we had to change rooms instantly as ther was a foul stench lingering in the room. The second room we went in the flooring outside was slanted , the window had moulld on it. There pictures on the website were totally misleading and i was disgusted that they showed a picture of a lion , this had no relevance to the hotel, the ' bar ' , in quotes was a plank of wood with a few chairs. well to conclude i think this has to be by far the worst hoteling experiance of my entire life!!!!! un happy person that stayed in hotel

Reviews.Title: “Misleading website!”
Reviews.Author: dina1norwich
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel just for an overnight stay during a visit to london. We were impressed by the 'impressive photos' on the website and found the price quite reasonable for the hotel and its location. However, when we arrived that was a different story. The whole place looked as though it just needed a good upgrade and just looked so dated. We changed rooms because the first one was just so dingy looking and the bedding was covered in cigarette stub holes and my brother even found random hairs in the bed. The bathroom was awful, again dated. The second room was a bit better with more light but the bathroom was the same. We wanted to leave and try and find somewhere else to stay but there was not much we could do as the refund process seemed too long winded. Overall i definately wouldn't recommend this place if you have high standards and another thing is, don't fall for the misleading images on the website and the nonsense about it being one of the best 2 stars around.

Reviews.Title: “It worked for us!”
Reviews.Author: izzobbed
Reviews.Content: Our family (my husband, myself, and two adult sons) recently stayed at the Mitre House for a week during a recent visit to London. While the rooms were nothing to write home about--rather small, at least by US standards, with lackluster decoration--the property worked well for our stay. The price couldn't be beat--125 GBP per night for a family suite (one double-bedded room and one twin-bedded room sharing a bathroom), with a full breakfast each morning included. The rooms were clean. The hotel felt safe. The staff was friendly and helpful. It was two and a half blocks from Paddington Station and about three blocks from the Lancaster Gate tube stop, so getting out and about was easy, even when we were carrying our luggage. And there were several decent pubs in the area--Sawyer's, the Dickens Tavern, and the Swan--plus a pretty decent fish and chips place around the corner. Unless I were planning to return to London in mid-summer (when I wilt and get cranky without air conditioning, which, unfortunately, the Mitre doesn't seem to have), I'd definitely plan to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: abearly
Reviews.Content: Good value for a family of four.100 pounds including breakfast.Close to restaurants and Paddington station

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Brevic
Reviews.Content: Mitre house has a great convenient location, from the airport and tube stations, tons of places to eat in the area. The hotel room was small, but was cozy not uncomfortable in size. The mattresses were not very comfortable that would be the only downfall. The shower and toilet were suitable rooms were always cleaned well. This hotel is not swanky but has a really nice personnel and you get free coffee which was actually good, and you can get a beer in the lobby in the evening. We arrived early before check in and we checked our bags and was offered a hot cup of coffee it was just what we needed. The english breakfast is complimentary and is really good too, the wait staff was fast and friendly. For a convenient and well priced hotel in the heart of paddington with complimentary breakfast and friendly staff for this price its a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “stay away”
Reviews.Author: MarKW0ts0n
Reviews.Content: What a mistake we made for booking this over priced budge hotel. As the owner of this hotel told us we made a mistake on the reservation so we had to pay for it. Yes, once you paid for your reservation and risk loss all of it if you walk away, you are at mercy of their greedy. We were told we had to upgrade to account for an additional person because of a young child. We had no problem for paying the difference between the list price of the room we booked and the room upgraded to. But the owner demanded us to pay the difference between the list price of upgraded room and the payment they received from the travel agent (which they claim to be low). We ended up paying 120% of the full list price of the upgraded room including their cost of doing business with online booking agency. We stayed at the Mitre House Hotel for five nights. They put us in a smoking room in the basement with poor sound insulation. The bed was hard, and you can feel the string. There is small TV with no remote control. The included English full breakfast served only from 7:30-9:00 am with same limited selection every day. No fruit served at the breakfast. Donâ€™t expect the same service from this place as a US-based three-star hotel/motel. We had bad experience with this hotel. Avoid that happens to you, Stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and great location”
Reviews.Author: Alaskan_travel
Reviews.Content: 4 of us just stayed at this hotel in a suite. After visiting London a few times I can tell you that you get your money's worth at this hotel. Around the corner from Paddington underground station it is a convenient location. With a great restaurant (Ask) around the corner and an internet cafe around the other corner. (It also has WIFI if you bring your laptop.) Hyde Park is just a couple blocks away. Desk staff were friendly and helpful when we had questions. Would definately stay here again. Breakfast was not sensational but a great way to start the morning. Breakfast staff and room cleanup crew were great.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and spare”
Reviews.Author: Kate4711
Reviews.Content: First, the good news. Cleanliness, fantastic location for public transportation, safe neighborhood, secure premises and comfy beds. I asked for and received a quiet room at the back of the hotel. Bad news. Bar and public lounge reek of smoke - perhaps the July 2007 Smoke-Free Britain will help. Lounge, bar, breakfast room and my room had no ambiance and lighting is dreadful. An overhaul to add cheer and decent lighting is necessary. Most of my time - like all travellers - is spent enjoying the city, however, when returning for downtime or an early evening, esthetics do matter. Staff helpfulness is mixed. Day staff - Katya and her son were lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: pinkapricot
Reviews.Content: This is my second time staying at the Mitre. The first time I stayed there, I got a very small double room on the ground floor. There was hardly enough space to put my luggage anywhere. The room was just big enough to fit a double bed, a small bedside table, a small cupboard and a TV on top of a narrow shelf. This time ard, my boyfriend and I got a triple room (I think they ran out of doubles) and it was more spacious only because there was an extra bed in the room. I used the single bed to put my luggage as well as my shopping bags. The heater in the room didn't seem to work very well and the bathroom was considerably warmer than the bedroom. It was alright for the first night, however, the second night was much colder and we did not sleep as well. We didn't get to try the breakfast (included in the room rate) as they stop serving breakfast by 9am. Location wise, Mitre is just down the road from Paddington station so it's convenient if you're coming into London by train. The cafe just next to Mitre called Nahar is highly recommended for Malaysian food. Probably would stay again in warmer weather and only for a night or two.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: buzibody
Reviews.Content: Don't be deceived by the ghostly green lights if you see the hotel after dark. It's a great place to stay with clean and well-kept rooms, even though it may be a bit small for 3 pax. Breakfast is great, especially for those with great appetites. Cosy reception, manned by efficient and knowledgeable staff. The hotel come with adequate basic amenities, including 24-hour availability of tea and coffee at the bar upon request. Location is excellent, being near the Paddington train station and tube. Also within walking distance to Kensington and Hyde Parks.

Reviews.Title: “What a place, what a fantastic staff !!”
Reviews.Author: verkoop
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels I ever stayed in. Real value for money. Especially the manager (Chris or Mr. Chris?) was very helpful. Will certainly visit again when in London! Gave me a lovely dairy on top of all the +++++++'s Thanks !!! Will recommend my Dutch relatives when they are over.

Reviews.Title: “Handy location”
Reviews.Author: Ocker
Reviews.Content: Based on web site, and reviews booked a five day stay in a "family room" for ourselves and two children (11 & 8). The family accomodation is a "strange" setup - enter through a common door into a small 4' x 4' area from which there is a door into a twin-bedded room wtih wash basin & TV. The other door leads to a bedroom with a DB and ensuite. Both of the door have door know barrel locks. The "common" door only has a flimsy 3" long surface mount slide lock (which was loose). Meaning that if the parents wanted to leave their bedroom door open for the children then the only security was the hopeless slide lock, which even a child pushing the door from the outside would have forced open the door. Aside from that, the rooms were comfortable and clean. But it have been nice to have tea/coffe making facilities in the room! Breakfast finishes at 9:00am, and whilst this may be OK for the numerous out-of-town trademen that use the hotel as a Mon-Fri London base, it is about 30 minutes too early for the tourist who wants to lie-in a bit later. The cosy bar and TV room are great to relax in after a day looking at the sites of London.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but simple”
Reviews.Author: AlexG75
Reviews.Content: We made a reservation by Internet, based on the hotels site. The room was small, but clead and nice. The food suplied by the hotel was good. Great value for your money, great location. We will probably stay again when we visit London next time.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Experience”
Reviews.Author: Kifle
Reviews.Content: We almost checked out after one night, because of tobacco smoke coming into our room - at heads of beds - at night. Breakfast was carelessly prepared, and no porridge or eggs other than fried were available during the last half-hour. However, we stayed, because staff were extremely kind and helpful about the room. They moved us to a large ground-floor room for the same rate as our second-floor double. It was quieter, had a slightly larger bathroom, and smelled really fresh each of our eight nights there. Breakfast, alas, was always the same: toast burnt on edges, soggy in center, every single morning. Coffee was instant. Some mornings the tea pot had two tea bags, some days one. Some servers had difficulty understanding English. Location is very handy for transportation around and beyond London. It's a very noisy neighborhood with sidewalks crowded with backpackers and luggage rollers who enjoy shoving pedestrians. Restaurants are mostly American fast food, but we really liked two Italian places close by. Two churches are within easy walking distance as well.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with no hidden charges!!”
Reviews.Author: Duncan_Viv
Reviews.Content: Excellent value. Its only a 10 min walk from Paddington Railway Station. Easy access to all floors of hotel. The price includes a good English breakfast. There were no 'hidden' charges ie service charges, car parking at hotel. Staff were great, all spoke English, (including waitresses ). Underground station 5 min walk. Our room was smallish, but adequate with full bathroom facilities. All areas very clean. Really recommend this hotel for travellers on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but with problems”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Mitre House is clean and a good pick for someone on a budget. The room was very small, but is not a huge problem. The cleaning service did a good job of making sure the room was clean every day. While the room and hotel was clean, it did lack some basic features expected in a hotel. Plan on living out of your suitcase. Rooms do not have dressers with minimal closet space. When we inquired about how much the fee was for using a phone card in the hotel, we were informed that it was 100 pounds. That calculates to about $180 to place an other wise free call. When we asked why it cost 100 pounds to use our phone cards, the gentleman at the desk was non-responsive while becoming very angry and insisted that we not use the rooms phones. Needless to say, we were a bit frightened and did our best to not to make any further requests for the duration of our stay. If these problems are ones you can live with, the Mitre House is a fine pick. It is clean and within walking distance of Paddington Station. It is reasonably priced and relativly close to major attractions. Do not expect luxury, and definetly do not expect to a smiling face to greet you at the door.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel with a few mishaps”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Good -The Mitre House is very clean as each day the rooms are refreshed nicely. In addition, the beds are quite comfortable. -The Mitre House is in a nice, convenient location. A 5 minute walk from Paddington station which has several subway lines. However, if you are flying from Gatwick airport I would recommend staying near Victoria Station instead which is more centrally located. Also, although the street right next to this hotel does have nice pubs and decent restaurants, most of the major siteseeing places are significant subway/bus rides away. The Bad -Some of the employees of the hotel are very unfriendly. Whether this is a big deal to you or not certainly depends. But, for example, I wanted to use my calling card from the room and I called down to the front desk to ask how to use the room phone. All I had to do was dial an 0800 number. However, the employee at the front desk would not activate my room phone and said that if I wanted to use it I would need to deposit 100 pounds! Also, if you stay at this hotel BRING YOUR OWN SHAMPOO. I asked for shampoo and one of the employees made a phone call to someone to request it for me. When I went down later to find out where the shampoo was another employee said they do not have any and I had to buy it around the corner. The next day they again told me to buy shampoo around the corner. When I went around the corner the cheapest and smallest bottle was about 4 pounds (this translates to about 7 dollars for a small bottle of shampoo). Again, not a big deal to some, but certainly at the time these were inconveinences. -The rooms are very small. We got used to it by the end of the stay, but just be aware. However, it is a good trade off for the price and cleanliness. If I was go to back to London I would stay near Victoria Station as the area seems a little more upscale and is more centrally located. However, for the very reasonable price that we paid we felt that we received a very clean hotel that in the end we were very satisfied with.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad at All”
Reviews.Author: erie.mon
Reviews.Content: We really had a great time in London and this hotel was a big help. Great location and very reasonable rates...the staff and breakfast was great...nothing special by US standards but everything you need and it was clean. Small rooms but this is Europe...get used to it. I am not sure I will return...but It won't be because I was disappointed. You get everything you pay for and more...plus a fullers london pride available in the lobby is always a big plus. Cheers

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Clean, Fab location”
Reviews.Author: YattyBrown
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel due to the reviews here. We got a double room and they've put in a travel cot in the room for our baby, which is fine for her. The room is small, but at least is clean and the bed is comfy. Our ensuite only had a shower. The shower is ace, really powerful. Beware, hot water is HOT! Breakfast is fine, cooked breakfast for us and porridge for little one. The location is great. Near tube station, loads of restaurants, and near Hyde Park. We went to the science museums and that's only half an our walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: YHosty
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Mitre House Hotel in February 2006 for three nights.The Hotel is in an excellent location,just afew minutes walk from Paddington Station.From Paddington you can get the Tube or Bus to anywhere in London.Also from Paddington the Heathrow express goes every 15 minutes to the airport.The hotel itself is very dated,and in need of some new decor.The rooms are fine,but the bed is terrible and my fiance had awful back pain in the morning because of this.The breakfast is fine,but the best thing about this hotel is it's location and the helpful staff.We asked to be changed to a different room as the one we were in had a strange noise coming from the radiator.The staff changed our room promptly,and were very helpful with any other queries we had.

Reviews.Title: “INCREDIBLY Convenient, Clean, & Economical”
Reviews.Author: LondonBunnies
Reviews.Content: Despite lackluster hosts, this hotel is THE place to stay if you are coming in to London from Heathrow. Paddington, being a major Tube Station, makes getting around London very easy. The 15 min. shuttle to Paddington Station is a breeze and merely one block away. We had a ground floor room facing the street which was surprisingly quiet and with the positioning of a basement access in front of the windows made security a non-issue. The size of the room was spacious from what we were expecting based on reviews we had read/seen. The bathroom had a full-bath/shower but the "single" room did have two, US twin-sized beds shoved together (with twin sheets). A pretty full English breakfast is served downstairs as well as the option of a decent porridge for the non-sausage crowd. Yes, you do need to leave your room key at the front desk when you leave but we found that so not to be an issue. The hotel bar is open :30 past 11pm which is when most of the pubs in the area close. To check out in the near proximity: Indian Food - Shalimar Garden, excellent, in the basement of the Prince William Hotel, Mongolian Food (that's correct & weekends only), McCahill's Pub, rediculious, I have a friend who worked at the BBC who nearly jumped out of her skin out of jealousy when I told her I went there--supposedly the best in London (it gets our votes), of course the Sussex Arms, the friendliest pub in the area (and not Menu I or II--you'll know what we mean after a day or two). Enjoy and we hope this helps. K & W

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Cats_123
Reviews.Content: stayed for just one night. Room was a standard double, nothing special, but a decent full english breakfast. the hotel is ideally situated for easy access to most of London's sights. A five minute stroll gets you on the tube. Plenty of restaurants/ cafe's bars around too. Can recommend Satay House in Sale Place (just a short walk away)

Reviews.Title: “Very Decent Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bc713
Reviews.Content: My husband & I spent 3 nights here in a junior suite which had a jacuzzi tub. The price for the suite was 110 GBP a night &, having stayed at several small hotels in London on other trips, I thought we got very good value for the money. True, the rooms are smallish, the TV isn't going to entertain you for long & we would have appreciated a coffee set-up in the room rather than in the bar area but we would still stay here again. The rooms were clean, the staff was very friendly & helpful & the area was perfect. There is a Hilton on Praed St. - right near Paddington - where you can go for more action than you'll find at the Mitre House bar & have actual cocktails which are sometimes difficult to find. Lots of good restaurants & pubs at all price levels in the area too. We also thought breakfast at the hotel was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Safe and good location at Mitre House”
Reviews.Author: Prairiewind
Reviews.Content: My 18 year old daughter and I spent 12 nights at Mitre House in London in May of 2005, and we were well pleased with our room and the friendly staff. Our room had comfy beds, TV, hot shower and a large wardrobe to put our clothes in. We felt very safe and the location is excellent -- right off Paddington Station and a direct trip from Heathrow Airport on the Heathrow Express. I can't tell you how many times we were singing the praises of being a couple blocks from Paddington Tube/Railway! The area is nice too with small restaurants, grocery stores, and nice parks nearby. We really enjoyed walking Hyde Park in the rain. This hotel is not fancy, but it is clean and reasonably priced. Since we stayed 12 nights, we got a nice deal on our room -- 75GBP per night. We figured since we only spent our sleeping hours in the room and had a hearty breakfast to start each day, this was a very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Little room but great breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent very lovely nine days in this hotel, paying a very good price booking by internet. The room was very small little for three star hotel, but we know that for English was normal size room, even if it was clean and the staff were friendly. Full English Breakfast Included, no Internet, tiny TV, no in-room Coffee-The (but they were free in the bar of the hotel). The location was great, near Paddington Train Station, Paddington and Lancaster Gate Tube Stations and Hyde Park. It was a safe and very quiet area and near the hotel there is a wide range of restaurants, banks, and little grocery stores. Would recommend it if you require a hotel to visit London.

Reviews.Title: “Staff were kind and helpful!”
Reviews.Author: TrvlnCalifornia
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at the Mitre house (Oct. 2002) when I was desperate to get into a London hotel. I had mistakenly booked a room outside of London, near Gatewick Airport, and found everything too far away! The staff were polite and friendly. I did not have any problem handing over my key when I left the hotel for the day. I had arranged to be in Paris for two days during my London stay and had expected to have to keep and pay for my room in London to have somewhere to store my extra luggage. I did not have to do this! The staff very kindly managed to keep my bag in a locked room off the lobby. I was checked out of my room and checked back into another room when I returned from Paris. I had a lovely (although a bit worn) room that over looked the street. The breakfast in the morning was lovely. Everyone was personable and friendly. For a woman travelling alone in a foreign country, I felt very safe staying at the Mitre House. I would stay there again, although it would be wonderful if they re-did the rooms.

HotelInfo.Name: Mitre House Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 180 Sussex Gardens, London W2 1TU, England
